quest.name: The Heart of Tankiness
journal:
Regitt believes the tanks' engines can be purring even more sweetly.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Shigitt has tasked you with crafting an engine component, then delivering the completed item to Regitt.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Our tanks may be imposing, but without their engines they're no more useful than a pile of scrap. The engine's not the only moving part, either─there are countless other gears and valves that need daily maintenance.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: I might even say our tanks are even more demanding than our beards! That is why you should be honored to receive the noble task of helping us keep them in tip-top shape. Our tanks, that is─not our beards.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Shigitt has all the details, and the supplies besides. I've already sent word ahead to expect you.

dialogue.name: SHIGITT
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are! This task has ramifications for our safety and livelihoods, and I would trust none other than you to get it done right.

dialogue.name: SHIGITT
dialogue.text: I require something small, but utterly essential: a single screw. I've chosen the materials most painstakingly─we cannot accept anything less than perfection for every step of this project. I've programmed the automaton to select its materials with equal care if you should run out.

dialogue.name: SHIGITT
dialogue.text: I require a cloth made from fine fibers of the utmost quality. I've chosen the materials most painstakingly─we cannot accept anything less than perfection for every step of this project. I've programmed the automaton to select its materials with equal care if you should run out.

dialogue.name: SHIGITT
dialogue.text: If the engine is the heart of our tanks, then oil is their lifeblood. One bottle should do for now. I've chosen the materials most painstakingly─we cannot accept anything less than perfection for every step of this project. I've programmed the automaton to select its materials with equal care if you should run out.

dialogue.name: SHIGITT
dialogue.text: Once you're finished, I think you know who to visit next. Godsspeed!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Back at last! And with vital parts for our engines, no doubt!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Hmm, yes, this certainly lives up to the high standards you've set thus far. I had it in mind to simply maintain the engines, but this may very well improve them.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Perhaps so much so that a new model name is in order. What do you say? How about...the Hellacious Hobsmasher Hammer Mark IX! For what is an anvil without a hammer to strike upon it?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Normal-quality items crafted in the course of this quest serve no purpose and cannot be sold. It is recommended that you discard them.
